channel.title: [Release] My 199 Server and Client
channel.description:
http://uppit.com/oxvx1siw50hi/199_Server_&_Client.zip
Project i've been working on, cbf doing more before I release, it's probably not usefull to anyone, but it'l make a good base if you want to start rather far back, it helped me learn alot, It comes with my client control panel, doesn't have to be used, just create .bat files, it monitors outgoing packets ect, was just easier to use because it told me what's what, I've ripped out EVERYTHING out of the server, attacking, trading, dueling, shops, prayer ect because it was coded extremely inaccurate and only 50% worked, yes, i'll admit I don't have the skills to re-code it all for myself and im not going to c&p from another server, The plan was to make everything totally custom. It tells you in-game what is and what's not implemented, by telling you the packet isn't implemented.
Uh both server and client contain documents, refactoring logs, packet names ect, i've done alot of work to the client, nothing really to the server except removing shit that isn't needed / doesnt work properly and tidying it up, This is the first thing i've really done in rsc, and im very new to java so don't hate too much :P
If you want to see the work i've done, just download shangtsung's src on here, it uses bakatools base and compare them.
Credits to Bakatool, shang but I basicly ripped out everything he'd done, a friend of mine for helping me with code, and myself for whatever I put in :P
pics:
[img]http://i38.tinypic.com/11i0iup.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i35.tinypic.com/2j1nf3p.jpg[/img]
This pic was done with paint, couldn't figure out how to get the image on there, hence my topics.
[img]http://i37.tinypic.com/2ue5swp.png[/img]
Guess I can add a bit more info, I've blocked packet 165 sending from the client, which is changing camera mode, sounds and mouse buttons, I don't see why it has to send a packet? And I should have explained what I was trying to accomplish first, it's supposed to be a base server for people who want to create a custom server/ normal server who want to code things their own way and learn insted of editing / copy and pasting things, same thing with client, which is why I added the refactor log, it's actually a great way to understand the rsc client and server, and java skills aswell. I don't really know anything about memory leaks/bugs/exploits anything like that, I do know in the client/server the object update needs to be sped up (loading trees ect when you walk around) , but from what i've seen it's stable and it does have the bare essentials, I hope someone can make use of this (: Im going to continue developing this into my own custom server, with custom menus/ trade menus what not, and I would appreciate if someone could point out some bugs ect stuff like that (:
these links were also helpfull,
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,8218.msg87217.html#msg87217 http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,236582.msg2013776.html#msg2013776
Thanks

item.title: [Release] My 199 Server and Client
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

UPDATE:

Added Full Saving/Loading,

If no save file, logs in with defaults, creates new.
Saves,

Password (Encrypted)
Stats
Exp
Items
Wielded Items
Item Counts
CurrentX
CurrentY
Skulled
Questpoints
Online
Rank

Also added, Invalid Password Check, Banned, Perm Banned, and If online don’t log in.

Added char fixes,

2-5 spaces get shorted to 1 space [ex (hello hi) to (hello hi)
Bad chars get converted to "_"s, Server converts them to “” [ex (hello@#$hi) to (hellohi)

Rank 0 = Normal
Rank 4 = Banned
Rank 5 = Permanantly Banned

Also quite a few commands added.

Clientside & Server Side.

Bugs:
None afaik, you can use ::save, or it saves when you log in / log out.
Might want to add some kind of auto saver, and im not too sure if it saves when the server crashs, most likely not.
Which will cause your online status remaining online, which won’t let you login.

Link:

http://uppit.com/152ttn7mxk48/199_Server_&_Client.rar

Thanks.

Read full topic
